Decreased access to information: Without books, people would have limited access to information, which could hinder their ability to learn, grow, and make informed decisions.

Impact on education: Books play a crucial role in education, serving as a primary source of information for students and scholars. Their extinction would have a profound impact on the education system.
Decreased literacy rates: Without books, people may not develop the habit of reading, leading to a decline in literacy rates.
Loss of literary works: Many books are works of art, and their extinction would mean the loss of countless literary masterpieces.
Decreased diversity: The extinction of books would result in a loss of diversity in literature, as new works would not be created.
